title: China, Indonesia Sovereign Wealth Funds Boost Investment Ties

title: Canada’s CDPQ to Invest More Than $10 Billion in UK, FT Says
content: Canadian pension fund Caisse de Depot et Placement du Quebec is looking at investing more than £8 billion ($10.8 billion) in the UK over the coming five years, the Financial Times reported.

title: Softbank’s Son Floats Idea of US-Japan Sovereign Wealth Fund: FT
content: SoftBank founder Masayoshi Son has proposed setting up a US-Japan sovereign wealth fund aimed at making large investments in technology and infrastructure, the Financial Times reported, citing three unidentified people close to the situation.

title: Australia’s East Coast Begins Flood Cleanup as Waters Recede
content: Australia has drafted in emergency service teams from across the nation to help with clean-up operations after devastating floods in the eastern state of New South Wales.

title: Fed to Take in Stride Another Month of Tame Inflation
content: The Federal Reserve may take comfort that tariffs have yet to materially boost official inflation readings, but policymakers will continue to suggest interest rates are on hold until they better understand the coming impact of US trade policy.

title: Junkiest Junk Is Offering a Warning Sign for Debt
content: For much of the year, money managers have embraced optimism and snatched up corporate bonds, sending valuations to ever more expensive levels. Now, Wall Street titans are saying it’s time to focus on how bad things can get.

title: Ukraine and Russia Biggest Wartime Exchange of Prisoners
content: Ukraine and Russia began the biggest prisoner exchange since the start of the full-scale invasion in 2022, even as Moscow resists efforts for a ceasefire. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Monsoon’s Earliest Onset in India Since 2009 Boosts Crop Outlook
content: The monsoon, a weather phenomenon that waters more than half of India’s farmland, reached the subcontinent before the usual time, boosting crop outlook and raising hopes the nation will lift remaining curbs on exports of farm goods.

title: Turkish Central Bank Tightens Screws on Cheap Lira Window Abroad
content: Turkey’s central bank raised the reserve requirement ratios on banks’ short term liabilities abroad in a bid to discourage local banks from seeking cheap lira from offshore markets.

title: Indonesia to Cut Transport and Power Prices to Spur Consumption
content: Indonesia will cut transport and power costs and deliver other stimulus in June and July in an effort to boost household spending and rekindle economic growth.

title: Pakistan’s Next Funding Review in Second Half of 2025, IMF Says
content: Pakistan has reaffirmed its commitment to fiscal consolidation and the International Monetary Fund will conduct its next funding review in the second half of this year, the multilateral agency said.

content: Switzerland’s bid for a US trade deal risks sparking a showdown with one political force at least as feisty as President Donald Trump: its own farmers.

And, an inside look at how a company’s heritage can shape its future through innovation and preservation. Victoria Mars talks about Mars’ core principles and how they are applied even without the Mars family in management positions. Enel’s former CEO Francesco Starace discusses how he was able to move his company forward through technological change. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Tether Focuses Elsewhere While US Seeks to Regulate Stablecoins

title: Record £1.23bn Paid Out in Pet Insurance Claims in 2024

title: NJ Transit Engineers Contract Will Hike Pay to Over $50 Per Hour

title: Travelers Avoid Trips to Japan Over Viral Comic Book’s Quake Prediction

title: CommScope Is Considering Sale of Broadband Arm CCS

title: Apple 25% Tariff Not as Bad as It Seems: Gene Munster
content: Gene Munster, Deepwater Asset Management managing partner, reacts to President Donald Trump pressuring Apple to manufacture its iPhones in the US, threatening a tariff of at least 25% if they don't comply. He speaks on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Polish Presidential Hopefuls Rally Supporters Ahead of Vote

title: Israel's Latest Strikes in Gaza Kill 38 People Including Children
content: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli strikes over the past 24 hours killed at least 38 people in Gaza, including a mother and her two children sheltering in a tent, local health officials said Sunday, with no data available for a second straight day from now-inaccessible hospitals in the north.

title: Prisoner Swaps Completed as Russia Fires Barrage at Kyiv

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
